what: Data examples to demo the package
title: XlsFormPrettyPrint Functions
text: included demo xlsform comes https://github.com/pmaengineering/ppp

title: XlsFormPrettyPrint Functions
code: check <- xlsform_compare(listfile = c( "demo.xlsx","demo_adapt1.xlsx","demo_adapt2.xlsx"),                            folder = stringr::str_sub(system.file("", package = "XlsFormPrettyPrint"), end = -1) ,                                              label_language = NULL,                          fileout = NULL) #> demo_adapt1.xlsx #>  #> demo_adapt2.xlsx  # variablescompare, knitr::kable(utils::head(as.data.frame(check[1]), 10)) # choicescompare knitr::kable(utils::head(as.data.frame(check[2]), 10, 10))

title: XlsFormPrettyPrint Functions
code: ## Generate the summary chart result <- interview_duration(    xlsformpath = system.file("demo.xlsx", package = "XlsFormPrettyPrint"),    label_language = NULL,   # wpm  word per minute - an average 180 word per minute (per default) required to read loudly the text   wpm  = 180,  # maxmodalities if more than 7 potential answers for a select question (per default)- then we assume that those modalities will not be read by the enumerator - but rather selected based on an open answer - and not be accounted for the modalities duration estimation   maxmodalities = 7 ,  # resptimeclose  an average 4 seconds (per default) for respondent to reply for closed questions   resptimeclose  = 4, # resptimecondopen an average of  7 seconds (per default) to reply to conditional text question (accounting for question type of "other, please specify").    resptimecondopen = 7, # resptimeopen an average of  10 seconds (per default) to reply to open text question.    resptimeopen = 10, # avrgrepeat In case of repeat questions, an average 3 repeat (per default) is accounted for.    avrgrepeat = 3    ) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> ! You did not set up any language requirement to launch the functions... Are you sure your xlsform does not include any language specifification like `English (eng)` or `Espa<f1>ol (es)` or `Fran<e7>ais (fr)`  result[["plot"]] result[["totaldur"]] #> [1] 12  knitr::kable(head(result[["variables"]], 15))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Edouard Legoupil. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Legoupil E (2023). XlsFormPrettyPrint: Output pretty version xlsform word print, review comments. R package version 0.1.2, https://edouard-legoupil.github.io/XlsFormPrettyPrint.
code: @Manual{,   title = {XlsFormPrettyPrint: Output a pretty version of an xlsform in word for print, review and comments},   author = {Edouard Legoupil},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.2},   url = {https://edouard-legoupil.github.io/XlsFormPrettyPrint}, }

what:
Output a pretty version of an xlsform in word for print, review and
    comments
title:
Output a pretty version of an xlsform in word for print, review and
    comments
text: customizing adjusting household survey questionnaire design phase, ’s often necessary one testing version (.e. encoded xlsform) legible version word can shared non-technical experts comment review. Moving paper version encoded-machine ready version smooth. Instead master version word updating xlsform, ’s convenient generate word output collect feedback word tracking mode. XlsFormPrettyPrint small utility quickly generate nicely printed version word master version xlsform. way comments circulated version can easily re-injected back master without loosing coding. default prettyprinting template brings single grid different parts xlsform. prettyprinting can done separately different language case xlsform includes one. template increases legibility question blocks: begin_group –> depending level output different style heading level begin_repeat –> displayed header specific distinct color note within block, question details included: question code & type question label & hint select_one select_multiple, modalities code label nested table present - question constraint warning message well related question skip logic addition, package includes: function interview_duration come estimation interview duration time, critical element consider ensure high quality data, function xlsform_compare compare different version similar xlsform.

title:
Output a pretty version of an xlsform in word for print, review and
    comments
code: install.packages("pak") pak::pkg_install('Edouard-Legoupil/XlsFormPrettyPrint')

title:
Output a pretty version of an xlsform in word for print, review and
    comments
text: XlsFormPrettyPrint installed, can create new RMD using custom template. Using RStudio: Step 1: Click “File” menu “New File” choose “R Markdown”. Step 2: “Template” tab, choose one built-templates. just need fill YAML parameters: dir: directory find xlsform save output file (absolute path relative current working directory). xlsformfile: Name questionnaire file character. package designed validate xlsform. Please use xlsform validator beforehand. label_language: Language used case one - instance “Español (es)”, “Français (fr)” “English (en)” . specified, ‘default_language’ ‘settings’ worksheet used. specified one language XlsForm, language comes first within column order used. can check example : xlsform resulting word

title:
Output a pretty version of an xlsform in word for print, review and
    comments
text: package mostly leverages capacity {flextable} package embed UNHCR template {unhcrdown}. Two R package / projects QuestionnaireHTML ODK2Doc built goal limited scope styling capacity. Last ’s also similar project python: https://github.com/pmaengineering/ppp

title: Generate a flextable from the pretty printed version of the xlsform — create_flextable
text: Note better legibility, advised put select question many possible answers - typically something like "country origin?" -  'select_from_file'

title: Generate a flextable from the pretty printed version of the xlsform — create_flextable
code: create_flextable(xlsformpath, label_language)

title: Generate a flextable from the pretty printed version of the xlsform — create_flextable
text: xlsformpath path file xlsform label_language Language used case one. specified, 'default_language' 'settings' worksheet used. specified one language XlsForm, language comes first within column order used.

title: Generate a flextable from the pretty printed version of the xlsform — create_flextable
text: flextable ready printed Rmd template word - using officedown.

title: Generate a flextable from the pretty printed version of the xlsform — create_flextable
code: create_flextable(   xlsformpath = system.file("demo.xlsx", package = "XlsFormPrettyPrint"),   label_language = NULL ) #> a flextable object. #> col_keys: `Questions`, `Choices`, `Variables`, `Logic`  #> header has 1 row(s)  #> body has 67 row(s)  #> original dataset sample:  #>   Questions              Choices   Variables Logic #> 1                 ( type: start)       start       #> 2                   ( type: end)         end       #> 3             ( type: simserial)   simserial       #> 4              ( type: deviceid)    deviceid       #> 5           ( type: phonenumber) phonenumber

what: Prepare a summary estimation of the interview duration. — interview_duration
title: Prepare a summary estimation of the interview duration. — interview_duration
text: designing questionnaire, key keep interview duration control. Typically less 20 minutes phone interview less 40 minutes face face interview. function designed provide rough estimate (aka guesstimate...) interview duration order assess element questionnaire design quality. questionnaire takes long, one needs trim split multiple ones... estimations provided function based series assumptions accounts following elements: time needed read label questions - note - Questions hint accounted tips enumerator read respondent time needed read question modalities - nothing xlsform tells whether enumerator expected read loudly potential answers case closed question, function parameter time need answer question - accounting 3 distinct situations, different potential duration: close questions - open questions open questions set skip logic typically - ", specify" - comes distinct response time time needed "repeat" block - typically questions repeated family roster -

title: Prepare a summary estimation of the interview duration. — interview_duration
code: interview_duration(   xlsformpath,   label_language = NULL,   wpm = 180,   maxmodalities = 7,   resptimeclose = 4,   resptimecondopen = 7,   resptimeopen = 10,   avrgrepeat = 3 )

title: Prepare a summary estimation of the interview duration. — interview_duration
text: xlsformpath path file xlsform label_language Language used case one. specified, 'default_language' 'settings' worksheet used. specified one language XlsForm, language comes first within column order used. wpm word per minute - average 180 word per minute (per default) required read loudly text maxmodalities 7 potential answers select question (per default)- assume modalities read enumerator - rather selected based open answer - accounted modalities duration estimation resptimeclose average 4 seconds (per default) respondent reply closed questions resptimecondopen average  7 seconds (per default) reply conditional text question (accounting question type ", please specify"). resptimeopen average  10 seconds (per default) reply open text question. avrgrepeat case repeat questions, average 3 repeat (per default) accounted .

title: Prepare a summary estimation of the interview duration. — interview_duration
text: list summary review visual format gpplot2 chart

title: Prepare a summary estimation of the interview duration. — interview_duration
code: ## Generate the summary chart result <- interview_duration(    xlsformpath = system.file("demo.xlsx", package = "XlsFormPrettyPrint"),    label_language = NULL,   # wpm  word per minute - an average 180 word per minute (per default) required to read loudly the text   wpm  = 180,  # maxmodalities if more than 7 potential answers for a select question (per default)- then we assume that those modalities will not be read by the enumerator - but rather selected based on an open answer - and not be accounted for the modalities duration estimation   maxmodalities = 7 ,  # resptimeclose  an average 4 seconds (per default) for respondent to reply for closed questions   resptimeclose  = 4, # resptimecondopen an average of  7 seconds (per default) to reply to conditional text question (accounting for question type of "other, please specify").    resptimecondopen = 7, # resptimeopen an average of  10 seconds (per default) to reply to open text question.    resptimeopen = 10, # avrgrepeat In case of repeat questions, an average 3 repeat (per default) is accounted for.    avrgrepeat = 3    ) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> ! You did not set up any language requirement to launch the functions... what: Render Word version of an xlsform — render_prettyprint
title: Render Word version of an xlsform — render_prettyprint
text: Us built template functions package generate word version xlsform

title: Render Word version of an xlsform — render_prettyprint
code: render_prettyprint(   dir,   xlsformfile,   label_language = NULL,   wpm = 180,   maxmodalities = 7,   resptimeclose = 4,   resptimecondopen = 7,   resptimeopen = 10,   avrgrepeat = 3 )

title: Render Word version of an xlsform — render_prettyprint
text: dir directory xlsform located xlsformfile name file xlsform label_language language sue generate pretty print wpm word per minute - average 180 word per minute (per default) required read loudly text maxmodalities 7 potential answers select question (per default)- assume modalities read enumerator - rather selected based open answer - accounted modalities duration estimation resptimeclose average 4 seconds (per default) respondent reply closed questions resptimecondopen average  7 seconds (per default) reply conditional text question (accounting question type ", please specify"). resptimeopen average  10 seconds (per default) reply open text question. avrgrepeat case repeat questions, average 3 repeat (per default) accounted .

title: Render Word version of an xlsform — render_prettyprint
text: word document
